title.value: Influence of mineral fertilizers on the photosynthetic activity of soybean crops
Влияние минеральных удобрений на фотосинтетическую деятельность посевов сои

journal.title: Agriculture and Plant Protection : scientific-practical journal

person.name: Bosak, V.N., Belarus State Technological Univ., Minsk (Belarus)
Koloskova, T.V., National Academy of Sciences (Belarus). The Scientific and Practical Center for Bioresources

abstract.value: In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus there was studied the influence of fertilizers on photosynthetic activity of soybean (Glycine max) grown on sod-podzolic sandy loam soil. In studies on sod-podzolic sandy loam soil application of fertilizer N10-70P40K90 had an effect on the photosynthetic activity of crops and yields of soybean varieties Pripyat. In the researches on the sod-podzolic loamy sandy soil photosynthetic potential of soy beans in the interphase period of flowering – formation of beans in fertilized variants was following. 0,19-0,26 million square m per day/ hectare; leaf surface area – 17,5 – 27,7 thousand square m per hectare; net photosynthetic productivity – 4,56 – 4,73 g per square m per day with productivity of grain 1,71 – 2,81 tons per hectare (with better results of productivity in version with applying in pre-sowing cultivation N50P40K90). Increase of doses of mineral nitrogen from 10 to 70 kg / ha helped to increase grain yield, but a significant yield increase was obtained only by increasing the dose of nitrogen up to N50.
